titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the J. W. Barstow recipes Biomed.0003
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kelly Besser, 2020.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2023 December 1.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-30 14:06:34 -0800.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: J.W. Barstow Recipes, 1849. (Manuscript Collection 3). Louise M. Darling Biomedical Library History and Special Collections Division, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A collection of medical recipes, mostly grouped by ailment, including remedies for dyspepsia, amenorrhea, typhoid fever, gonorrhea, asthma, dropsy, and other conditions. Roughly one-third of the pages have been filled in.
